results.title: Wittgenstein
results.creator_credit: Derek Jarman, Tariq Ali, Bandung Prod, British Film Institute and Channel 4 Television
results.brief_description: Ludwig Wittgenstein was born in Vienna in 1889 and he was to develop some of the most important twentieth century work on the philosophy of language and meaning. Jarman’s experimental biography is highly theatrical, interspersing biography, soliliquies, lavish fantasy and dream sequences. The film traces Wittgenstein’s life through World War I; his career as a school-teacher and eventually as an academic at Cambridge University; to his final abandonment of classical philosophy and the development of a challenging deconstruction of language which was to bring him in conflict with more positivist philosophies. Scripted by renowned English academic, Prof. Terry Eagleton, the film revolves around a series of arguments and discussions between Wittgenstein, Betrand Russell and their academic peers. This intelligent film links abstract discourse to the politics of everyday life. In the long run, Wittgenstein’s break with the hierarchy at Cambridge is not only a product of intellectual speculation but rooted in his problematic and alienated homosexuality which could not find direct expression in the higly austere and conventional environment of “high academia”. Though this film demands rigorous attention it is also a highly stylised and beautiful exercise in the possibilities of experimental cinema. With Tilda Swinton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek Jarman, Tariq Ali, Bandung Prod, British Film Institute and Channel 4 Television

results.title: The Last Bolshevik
results.creator_credit: Chris Marker, Michael Kustow and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Chris Marker, the acclaimed director of “Sunless” is one of the cinema’s most compelling documentary film-makers. This engrossing film is firstly a tribute to Alexander Medvedkin, a Soviet film-maker and revolutionary, who eventually to fell victim to Stalin’s infamous purges. “The Last Bolshevik”, framed around six imaginary letters to Medvedkin by Marker, is also a mediation on the history of Soviet communism and a critical examination of revolutionary aesthetics. Marker was a central figure in the French New Wave and was involved in rehabilitating Medvedkin’s career in the late-1960s. It is then also a personal self-appraisal of the artist’s own politics and aesthetics, an appraisal which aims to investigate what drew artists to the radicalism of Soviet Bolshevism and the consequences for “radical art” now that Communism has been discredited. The film not only explores Medvedkin’s work but also the cinema of Eisenstein and Dziga-Vertov. A documentary that assumes intelligence and philosophical eruditness from its audience is rare indeed. This melancholy farewell to the dream of “creating utopia” is a wonderful film.

results.title: The Nostradamus kid
results.creator_credit: Bob Ellis, Terry Jennings and Beyond Films
results.brief_description: Ken Elkin (Noah Taylor) an over-sexed, hyperactive youth with a taste for personal melodrama, first encounters the end of the world at the annual Seventh Day Adventist Camp in 1956. Convinced by an eloquent heretic that all Adventists are to burn in hell the following Saturday, Elkin fears that his true love for the pastors’ daughter will never be consummated - but the world doesn’t end. Arriving in Sydney in 1962 to attend University, Elkin encounters the world’s end for a second time while besieging the wealthy and beautiful Jennie O’Brien (Miranda Otto) with his misguided affection. Believing that with the Cuba Missile Crisis the end of world is truly nigh, the paranoid Elkin persuades Jennie to flee Sydney for the safety of the nearby mountains. However, the much longed for apocalypse is once again postponed and he returns to face the wrath of Jennie’s father. Cast also includes Arthur Dignam, Jack Campbell and Erik Mitsak.

results.title: Spartacus
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Robert Lawrence, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Kubrick, Robert Lawrence, Edward Lewis, Bryna Productions and Universal Pictures
results.description: Spartacus is a rousing testament to the spirit and dignity of man, dealing with a revolt by slaves against the pagan Roman Empire, based on the novel by Howard Fast. As a spectacle, the clash between the slave army led by Kirk Douglas, and the Romans commanded by Laurence Olivier, is nothing short of amazing. Douglas is the mainstay of the picture. He is not particularly expressive, in contrast to the sophisticated Olivier, the conniving parasite gladiator ring operator portrayed by Peter Ustinov or the supple and subtle slave maiden played by Jean Simmons. However, Douglas succeeds admirably in giving an impression of a man who is afire within. Some 8,000 Spanish soldiers became Roman legionaires for the massive battle sequences filmed outside Madrid, but the rest of the picture was made in Hollywood. Cast also includes Charles Laughton. Based on novel by Howard Fast.

results.title: JFK: Director's cut. Beyond JFK: the question of the conspiracy
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho and Ixtlan Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring Kevin Costner, Joe Pesci, Tommy Lee Jones, and Gary Oldman, JFK also features an extensive gallery of appearances by acclaimed actors including Ed Asner, Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon and Donald Sutherland. This exclusive release has an exta 17 minutes of new footage added, providing more excitement, intrigue and insight into Jim Garrison’s turbulent investigation of President John F. Kennedy’s assassination. Also included on this tape is “Beyond JFK: The question of the conspiracy” a ninety-minute documentary that re-examines the issues raised by the film, featuring interviews with the people who were involved in the Garrison investigation plus astonishing eyewitness accounts. Includes Jim Garrison’s last recorded interview before he died.

results.title: Asterix in Britain
results.creator_credit: Pino Van Lamsweerde, Yannik Piel, Dargaud Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The world-famous comic-strip character, that madcap Gaul, Asterix is brought to life in this animated feature. The battle skills of the Britons are undeniably the equal of Caesar’s Roman troops. However, they are handicapped by their habit of refusing to fight on weekends and leaving the battlefield promptly at five every afternoon in time for tea. Whilst the Britons are caught napping after dinner, the Romans win the war and overrun Britain. A plea from the English leader, Zebigboss, goes out to the mighty Asterix and his Roman-hating friend Obelix. Join all the familiar friends in this great adventure including Druid Getafix, Dogmatix, Chief Vitalstatistix, Cacofonix and many more. Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Madeline's Christmas
results.creator_credit: Stephen Martiniere, Ronald A Weinberg, Cinar and France Animation
results.brief_description: Madeline (the mischievous little heroine with a heart twice her size) and eleven of her friends experience a snowstorm and are confined indoors. But it’s Christmas so Madeline cares and cleans for her sneezing friends with many songs and cheer, reminding us all of the true spirit of Christmas - love and friendship. Based on the popular novels by Ludwig Bemelmans and narrated by Christopher Plummer.

results.title: My little chickadee
results.brief_description: Mae West is teamed with W.C. Fields in this classic comedy filled with Wild West action and lusty humour. The familiar Westian swagger, drawl, wisecracks and innuendos are all included, likewise the typical Field’s routines and quick-triggered comments. The pairing of the two stars was at the time considered to ensure a box-office success, but it would see sparks fly with the clashing of two great super-egos. However a West-Fields non-aggression pact was inspired in part by the fact that the two players wrote their own screen story. Scenes in which the pair work together are reduced to a minimum with the script set up being a continual series of episodes, first with West and then with Fields. The story is simple; Flower Belle Lee, returning from a complete course in a Chicago dance hall, has a way with men. A masked bandit falls in love with her, which eventually leads to her being drummed out of town. Meeting Cuthbert J. Twillie on the train on the way out, she believes him to have money, and promotes a fake wedding ceremony. The pair hit the next fronteir settlement, where Twillie becomes the sherrif, and West tosses her charms around rather freely.

results.title: Aladdin
results.creator_credit: John Musker, Ron Clements and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Soar away on a magic carpet ride of non-stop enchantment in the most spectacular animated adventure of all time. Outrageously funny, furiously fast-paced and packed with dazzling surprises this film won two Academy Awards for Best Song (‘A Whole new world’) and for Best Score. Follow the fantastic story of Aladdin, a street-smart peasant boy who, with one rub of a magic lamp, meets up with the most hip, hilarious, totally unpredictable Genie the screen has ever seen. But the evil sorcerer, Jafar, also craves the lamp’s power. If Aladdin is to defeat him and win the love of the free spirited Jasmine, he must learn to be himself - and that’s one wish the Genie can’t grant! Now enjoy the breathtaking Disney artistry and phenomenal fun. Robin Williams is hilarious as the voice of the Genie. Voices also include Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin, Jonathan Freeman, Frank Welker.

results.title: Sky trackers
results.creator_credit: John Power, Anthony Buckley and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: It started as innocent fun and turned into an adventure of galactic proportions! Ali (Maia Brewton) lives on a NASA Satellite Tracking Station where her Mum (Pamela Sue Martin) works as a space scientist. A computer whiz, Ali spends her spare time hacking into the station’s mainframe to record her personal diary. One evening while hacking into the computer she discovers a runaway satellite is out of control and heading straight for Earth and is likely to crash nearby. What she doesn’t know is that the satellite contains a load of deadly cargo, so dangerous it threatens the safety of the entire world…
